page.title: 02Indigenous Poetry: FINTRY
page.content: The last verse of a poem/song, one of many, previously not written down. Jake has spent a long life working in here abouts. It expresses what many feel. { ROCKY DUNMORE { } 'Tween the wood and the water the deer happly sleeps. { Guarded well by the hills o' { Stronend and Skidoo. { } As the acres awake at the dawn's rosy break, { O' the sweet singing Laverock { and haunting Cuckoo. O' fain would I bide with such beauty and rest, { Till life's troubled battles { and journeys are o'er. { } Though poor be my lot and humble my cot, { In Fintry snug sheltered by { rocky Dunmore.
